revised_title: Stability in Plant Communities of the Park Grass Experiment
tldr: This study investigates the relationship between species richness, soil pH, and biomass variability in plant communities of the Park Grass Experiment. The research found that biomass variability may be lower in more species-rich communities, and physiological stresses from low pH may explain the greater variability of plots with acidified soil. Three hypotheses are proposed to explain the relationship between species richness and biomass variability, which can be tested within the Park Grass Experiment.
